member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.Renderers.GridCellDateTimeRenderer
member.summary:
GridCellDateTimeRenderer is a class for cell renderer that displays in a . The class provides strong typed override methods for initializing Content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals. Upon editing it displays for editing values.
Updates to appearance and Content of child elements, creation and unloading of views will not trigger layout or render calls in parent canvas.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.Renderers.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Provides classes and interface for all cell renderer that manages the creation of cells view objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the views. Contains logics to place the UIElement inside cells in display and edit mode. It also contains the custom views that are created for rendering in the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridSummaryColumn.SummaryMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a valueï¿½that decidesï¿½whether summary calculation is processed based on display value in case of indexer and complex properties or default value in case of CLR properties of the column.
member.value: The that decidesï¿½whether summary calculation is processed based on display value or default value. The default value is .
member.remarks: By default, the summary for the column will be calculalted using DataReflectionMode Defaultonly. For complex properties use DataReflectionMode.Display to fetch values using custom logic. For simple CLR properties use DataReflectionMode.Default to fetch values using default logic.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.PullToRefreshView.RefreshCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the command to be executed when performing the pulling operation to refresh the grid. You must set this property to an and the property to true to enable pulling operation in SfDataGrid. This command will be fired upon performing the pulling operation for doing the refreshing operation.
member.value: The command to be executed when PullToRefresh action is performed.
member.remarks:
provides an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. will be fired to refresh (add, delete or modify the underlying data) the grid. A busy indicator will be displayed to denote the refreshing operation.
The pull to refresh command can also be set using property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.PullToRefreshView.IsBusy
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid is busy in refreshing the underlying data by executing the .
member.value: The boolean value indicating whether the grid is busy in refreshing the underlying data.
member.remarks:
The pull to refresh view will be in busy state, in the mean time pull to refresh command is executed, Refer the below code example in which the state is set as true before executing the and set as false, once the command is executed.
The busy state of the pull to refresh view can also be tracked by the property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridRowInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary:
GetHashCode is intended to serve as a hash function for this object. Based on the contents of the object, the hash function will return a suitable value with a relatively random distribution over the various inputs.
The default implementation returns the [....] block index for this instance. Calling it on the same object multiple times will return the same value, so it will technically meet the needs of a hash function, but it's less than ideal. Objects (especially value classes) should override this method.
member.returns: Return a suitable value with a relatively random distribution over the various inputs based on the contents of the object.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid
member.summary: A data bound list control that displays the items from data source in a tabular view. The SfDataGrid control allows you to select, sort and group these items.

remarks.para: The SfDataGrid control provides a flexible way to display a collection of data in rows and columns. The SfDataGrid includes built-in column types and a template column for hosting custom content.

To bind the SfDataGrid to data, set the property to an IEnumerable implementation. Each row in the data grid is bound to an object in the data source, and each column in the data grid is bound to a property of the data object. In order for the SfDataGrid user interface to update automatically when items are added to or removed from the source data, the SfDataGrid must be bound to a collection that implements the interface, such as an . To automatically reflect property changes, the objects in the source collection must implement the interface.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.AutoExpandGroups
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the should auto expand groups when grouping. By enabling, this property, when the user group any column, then all groups will be in expanded state.
member.value: True if auto expand groups is enabled, otherwise, false. The default value is true.

example.code: this.dataGrid.AutoExpandGroups = true;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.AllowGroupExpandCollapse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow expanding and collapsing of groups in . By default, the groups will be in expanded state in , when grouped. However, the user can expand or collapse a group in runtime by enabling this property.
member.value: True if expand and collapse groups is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is false.

example.code: this.dataGrid.AllowGroupExpandCollapse = true;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.AllowSwiping
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value denoting whether to enable/disable the swiping in control. Swipe views are displayed when swiping from â€˜left to rightâ€™ or â€˜right to leftâ€™ on a data row when swiping is enabled.
member.value: True, if swiping is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When swiping is enabled in , the swipe view can be displayed when swiping from â€˜left to rightâ€™ or â€˜right to leftâ€™ on a data row. allows the user to customize the swipe views to be displayed by using and . The swipe gesture can be restricted up to a certain point by using property.

example.code: dataGrid.AllowSwiping = true;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.MaxSwipeOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum swipe offset of control. enables the swiping option by setting the to true. Swipe views are displayed when swiping from â€˜left to rightâ€™ or â€˜right to leftâ€™ on a data row. The swipe gesture can be restricted up to a certain point by using this property.
member.value: The maximum swipe offset of SfDataGrid. The default value is 200.

example.code: dataGrid.MaximumSwipeOffset = 300;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.PullToRefreshView
member.summary: Gets or sets the view to indicate the Progress of pulling operation in a SfDataGrid. Any view that can indicate the Progress of the pulling can be assigned to the property such that it animates the values of the Progress of pulling.
member.value: The view that is displayed when pull to refresh is done.
member.remarks: provides you an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. A command will be fired when pulling action is performed and it can be used to refresh (add, delete or modify the underlying data) in the grid. To enable the pull to refresh feature, you must set the to true and also must set the command to property. By default, a busy indicator will be displayed when doing the pulling action. However, SfDataGrid allows you to customize this view based on the requirement using property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.PullToRefreshCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the command to be executed when performing the pulling operation to refresh the grid. You must set this property to an and the property to true to enable pulling operation in SfDataGrid. This command will be fired upon performing the pulling operation for doing the refreshing operation.
member.value: The command to be executed when PullToRefresh action is performed.
member.remarks: provides an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. will be fired to refresh (add, delete or modify the underlying data) the grid. A busy indicator will be displayed to denote the pulling and refreshing operation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.LoadMorePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position to load the in control. When the grid is scrolled to the last record of the collection, a view will be displayed which provides an option to load more items when the is tapped. The user can customize the position of the either to appear in the bottom or top below the header using this property. To enable the load more option, it is mandatory to set as true.
member.value: The to display the in SfDataGrid. The default value is .
member.remarks: allows the user to customize the position of the . By default, the load more view will be positioned at the bottom of . The user can customize the load more view to appear in the top below the header by setting as .

example.code: dataGrid.LoadMorePosition = LoadMoreViewPosition.Top;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.LoadMoreView
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the , which will be displayed when the grid is scrolled to the last position of , provided that is set as true.
member.value: The of SfDataGrid.
member.remarks:
provides an option to load more items in runtime, when the grid is scrolled to the last record of the collection. A command will be fired when the is tapped and it can be used to add more items to the underlying data. To enable the load more feature, you must set the to true and also must set the property.
By default, load more view is a button, containing the text "LOAD MORE ITEMS". allows to customize the load more view, by implementing the class and setting the customized load more view class to .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.LoadMoreText
member.summary: Gets or sets the load more text to be displayed in the . By default, the displays the "LOAD MORE ITEMS" text, the user can customize the text to be displayed in the by using this property.
member.value: The text to be displayed in . By default, the value is "LOAD MORE ITEMS".

example.code: dataGrid.LoadMoreText = "Load More Items";

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.LoadMoreCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the command to be executed when an end-user taps the to load new data items in .
member.value: The command to be executed when load more view is clicked.
member.remarks: allows to load more items in the datagrid, when the last data of the collection is reached, by executing the when an end-user taps the of .

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the busy state of the when executing the or .
member.value: True if SfDataGrid is executing either the or , otherwise false. By default the value is false.
member.remarks: will be busy when the underlying collection is refreshed or modified by executing the or .

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable/disable the refreshing option upon pulling the grid. On enabling this property, provides an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. The refreshing can be done using the and hence it is mandatory to set the property too for enabling the refreshing option.
member.value: True if pull to refresh is enabled, otherwise False. By default, value is false.
member.remarks: provides an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. A command will be fired and it can be used to refresh (add, delete or modify the underlying data) the grid. To enable the pull to refresh feature, you must set the to true and also must set the property. By default, a busy indicator will be displayed when doing the pulling animation. However, allows you to customize this view based on the requirement using property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.AllowLoadMore
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable/disable the load more option for adding more records in runtime, when the grid is scrolled to the last record of the collection. On enabling this property, provides an option to add more items to the underlying collection when the is tapped, by executing the and hence it is mandatory to set the property too for enabling the load more option.
member.value: True, if load more is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: provides an option to load more items in runtime, when the grid is scrolled to the last record of the collection. A command will be fired when the is tapped and it can be used to add more items to the underlying data. To enable the load more feature, you must set the to true and also must set the property. By default, a button will be displayed when the grid is scrolled to the last record. However, allows you to customize this view based on the requirement using property.

In order for the SfDataGrid user interface to update automatically when items are added to or removed from the source data, the SfDataGrid must be bound to a collection that implements the interface, such as an . member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.SortComparers

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.CellRenderers
member.summary: Gets the that contains the cell renderers in . The manages the creation of cells view objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the views. Contains logics to place the UIElement inside cells in display and edit mode.

member.remarks:
The manages the creation of cells view objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the views. Contains logics to place the UIElement inside cells in display and edit mode. The user can implement the renderer by extending it from the renderer he needs and customize the type of cell to be loaded for each column type in editing and normal mode.
Note:When the user overrides the renderer, he needs to replace it in the collection. For example, if the user implements the class, to customize the cell in the , then he needs to replace it in the collection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.AllowDraggingColumn

member.remarks: allows you to drag and drop a row by setting the property to true. A customizable row drag and drop view is displayed while dragging a row. The swipe gesture can be restricted up to a certain point by using property. The contents inside the swipe view are arranged based on the offset values when you swipe a data row.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.SfDataGrid.RightSwipeView

The swipe gesture can be restricted up to a certain point by using property. The contents inside the swipe view are arranged based on the offset values when you swipe a data row.

member.summary: Represents a customized view that loads new data items in runtime.
member.remarks:
A LoadMoreView represents a customized view that is loaded either at the top or bottom based on the property.
LoadMore option can be enabled in a control, by setting the property to true and by setting the property. When the LoadMore is enabled, the provides an option to load a subset of data to its data source in the runtime using the .

members.member:
Gets the resolved resizing column index for the given column index based on DataGrid's Column collection.
/// The SfDataGrid. The column index based on DataGrid's Column collection. The resolved resizing column index.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn
member.summary: Serves as the base class for the different column types of the control.
member.remarks: This abstract class provides the base functionality for all columns.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GridColumn class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.ColumnSizer
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates how the column width is determined.
member.value: One of the enumeration that adjust the column width. The default value is none.

example.code: GridNumericColumn numericColumn = new GridNumericColumn(); numericColumn.ColumnSizer = ColumnSizer.Star;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.LineBreakMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the for the cells in the column. The user can customize the line breaking mode of by using this property. By default, the word will be wrapped in the record cells, when the text for the record cells exceeds the content area.
member.value: The for the cells in the column. The default value is

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the view used to display the header of the current column. allows you to customize the header cell based on your requirement by using this property.
member.value: The view used to display the header of the current column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.ActualWidth
member.summary: Gets the actual width of the grid column.
member.value: The actual width of the grid column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.LoadUIView
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to load UIView or draw cell value in Android.
member.value: True if UIView is loaded in the grid cell, otherwise false. The default value is false for Android platform and true for iOS platforms.
member.remarks: By default, draws the value in the cell for Android platform. The user can customize the to load the UIElement for android platform, by setting as true.

example.code: GridTextColumn column = new GridTextColumn(); column.LoadUIView = true;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.MappingName
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapping name that associates the column with a property in the bound data source.
member.value: The mapping name that associates the column with a property in the data source.

example.code: GridTextColumn column = new GridTextColumn(); column.MappingName = "OrderID";

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.UserCellType
member.summary: Gets or sets the UserCellType of the grid column. This property is used when the user needs a template column. The user can create a template column to load the content of the cell in the GridColumns with your own view by creating custom GridCell to render in the column.
member.value: The type of the cell in which the content of the cell is displayed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.AllowSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column can be sorted or not.
member.value: True if sorting for the column is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: allows sorting for the column only when both and is true. This enables the user to restrict a particular column from being sorted by setting as false.

example.code: GridTextColumn column = new GridTextColumn(); column.AllowSorting = false;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.Format
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that indicates the format applied for the content of record cells in the column. enables the user to apply Format for the records in the cells by setting this property.
enables the user to populate the data for the using this property. This property enables the user to format the values of other columns and display the formatted value in unbound column.
member.value: The format applied to the record in the cells.
member.remarks:
enables the user to apply Format for the records in the cells by setting this property. Assign the FormatString to this property based on the type of the property the GridColumn is associated with to format the value.
enables the user to populate the data for the using this property. This property enables the user to format the values of other columns and display the formatted value in unbound column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.CultureInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the Culture used for formatting the content of record cells in the column. enables the user to apply different culture to the records in the cells by setting this property.
member.value: The Culture used for formatting the content of record cells in the column.
member.remarks: allows you to apply different for the GridColumns by using this property. Assign the FormatString to this property based on the type of the property the column is associated with to format the value. The user can use different StringFormats to customize the value displayed in the record cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.HeaderTextMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding applied to the header cells in the column.
member.value: The padding applied to the header cells in the column.

example.code: GridTextColumn column = new GridTextColumn(); column.HeaderTextMargin = new Thickness(10,5,10,5);

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.TextMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding applied to the record cells in the column.
member.value: The padding applied to the record cells in the column.

example.code: GridTextColumn column = new GridTextColumn(); column.TextMargin = new Thickness(10,5,10,5);

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.HeaderCellTextSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size for the content of header cell in the column. The font size for the content of header cell in the GridColumn can be customized by using the this property.
member.value: The font size for the content of header cell in the column. The default value is 12.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.CellTextSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size for the content of record cells in the column. The font size for the content of record cells in the GridColumn can be customized by using this property.
member.value: The font size for the content of record cells in the column. The default value is 14.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.RecordFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the content of record cells in the column. The font for the content of record cells in the GridColumn can be customized by using this property.
member.value: The font for the content of record cells in the column. The default value is "HelveticaNeue".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.HeaderFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the content of header cell in the column. The Font for the content of header cells in the GridColumn can be customized by using this property.
member.value: The font for the content of header cell in the column. The default value is "Helvetica-Bold".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.TextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the for the record cells in the column.
member.value: The for the record cells in the column. The default value is .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.HeaderTextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the for the header cell in the column.
member.value: The for the header cell in the column. The default value is .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.AllowEditing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable/disable editing for a column. The user can enable or disable editing for particular column by using this property.
member.value: True if editing for the column is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is false.

example.code: GridTextColumn column = new GridTextColumn(); column.AllowEditing = false;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.GroupMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that decides whether grouping is processed based on display value or edit value or value in the underlying collection of the column.
member.value: The that decides whether grouping is processed based on display value or edit value or value in the underlying collection of the column. The default value is .
member.remarks: By default, column grouping occurs based on the value in the underlying collection thereby creating a new group for each new value of that column. also allows the user to group a column either on the display value or edit value of the column using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.CellType
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell type of the . This property is used to identify the type of the column. This property must be specified with a string value when creating a custom column extending from the base class.
member.value: The CellType of the .
member.remarks: enables the user to create their own column type when the available column type does not meet his requirements. The user must set the of the grid column to the type of UIElement to be loaded in the grid cell. It is mandatory to create a custom cell renderer for the custom column created and it must be added in the collection. The user can handle his customizations in the custom renderer class implementing the .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.IsHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the visibility of the column. allows you to hide a particular column using this property.
member.value: True if the column is hidden, otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: allows you to hide a particular column by two ways, the user can either set property as true or set as 0.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the column width. The user can customize the column width by using this property. By default, this property will not be assigned any value and the GridColumn renders in view based on the value of property.
member.value: The width of the column. The default value is

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.MinimumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower bound for the width of the column.
member.value: The minimum width constraint of the column. The default value is 20 .
member.remarks: When is enabled, the column can be resized from to . Hence, using this property the user can restrict the minimum width the column can be resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.MaximumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper bound for the width of the column.
member.value: The maximum width constraint of the column. The default value is double.NaN.
member.remarks: When is enabled, the column can be resized from to . Hence, using this property the user can restrict the minimum width the column can be resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridColumn.SortMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a valueï¿½that decidesï¿½whether sorting calculation is processed based on display value in case of indexer and complex properties or default value in case of CLR properties of the column.
member.value: The that decidesï¿½whether sorting calculation is processed based on display value or default value. The default value is .
member.remarks: By default, the sorting for the column will be calculalted using DataReflectionMode Defaultonly. For complex properties use DataReflectionMode.Display to fetch values using custom logic. For simple CLR properties use DataReflectionMode.Default to fetch values using default logic.

member.summary: Gets or sets the display member path that associates the column with a property in the data source. The property of the collection binded to the display member path will be the content of the grid cell in normal and editing mode. The value will be displayed in the grid cell only when the is equal to the , else the grid cell will be blank. But the value corresponding to the given property in the data source will be displayed in the picker in edit mode.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridCellRendererBase
member.summary:
The class provides a default implementation of the interface for a cell renderer. You should derive from this class to implement custom cell renderer classes. There is however no dependency on GridCellRendererBase inside of the control.
If you want to implement a renderer with support for live views inside the cell you should derive from the or grid adapted VirtualizingCellRendererBase classes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridCellRendererBase.SupportsRenderOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the renderer supports rendering itself directly to the drawing context. When this is possible the UIElement will only be created when the user moves the mouse over the cell or if the UIElement is needed for other reasons, e.g. animate after change. The benefit of rendering directly to the DrawingContext instead of creating the UIElement is a much improved scrolling performance.
member.value: True if the renderer supports optimization, otherwise false. The default value is true.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridVirtualizingCellRenderer`2
member.summary:
GridVirtualizingCellRenderer is an abstract base class for cell renderer classes that need live views displayed in a cell. You can derive from this class and provide the type of the UIElement you want to show inside cells as type parameter. The class provides strong typed virtual methods for initializing content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals. See for more details.
The idea behind this class is to provide a place where we can add general code that should be shared for all cell renderer classes in the tree derived from GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase. While this class does at the moment not add meaningful functionality to GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase we created this extra layer of inheritance to make it easy to share code for the GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase base class between grid and common assemblies and keep grid control specific code out of the base class. It is currently not possible with C# to the base class as template type parameter.
member.typeparam: The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in display mode.
The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in edit mode.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2
member.summary:
VirtualizingCellRendererBase is an abstract base class for cell renderer classes that need live views displayed in a cell. You can derive from this class and provide the type of the view you want to show inside cells as type parameter. The class provides strong typed virtual methods for initializing content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals.
The class manages the creation of cells View objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the Views. The class offers an optimization in which Views can be recycled when is set. In this case when a cell is scrolled out of view it is moved into a recycle bin and the next time a new View is scrolled into view the element is recovered from the recycle bin and reinitialized with the new content of the cell.
Updates to appearance and content of child elements, creation and unloading of views will not trigger Layout or Render calls in parent canvas.
member.typeparam: The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in display mode.
The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in edit mode.

member.summary: The recycle bin which holds the UI which is loaded in the display mode of the cell.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2.editRecycleBin
member.summary: The recycle bin which holds the UI which is loaded in the edit mode of the cell.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2.AllowRecycle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether views can be recycled when scrolled out of view. In this case when a cell is scrolled out of view it is moved into a recycle bin and the next time a new element is scrolled into view the element is recovered from the recycle bin and reinitialized with the new Content of the cell.
member.value: True if elements can be recycled when scrolled out of view, otherwise false. The default value is true.

member.summary: Clears the recycle bin. The cell element will be stored for recycling purpose, when the cell element is scrolled out of view. This method clears all the cell elements which are stored for recycling purpose.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.VirtualizingCellUIElementBin`1
member.summary:
This class implements a cache of view of the given type parameter T. It is used by the renderer to recycle View elements for cells that were scrolled out of view and delay unloading of views.
This reduces the number of times the views needs to be created or unloaded and instead only the contents of the views will be reinitialized with cell contents.

member.summary: Compares the given object to another object, returning an integer that indicates the relationship. An implementation of this method must return a value less than zero if this is less than the given object, zero if this is equal to the given object, or a value greater than zero if this is greater than the given object.

member.returns: An integer that indicates the relationship between the current object and the given object.

member.summary: Compares the values in the given CoveredCellInfo object with the current instance, returning an integer that indicates the relationship. member.param: A CoveredCellInfo object which is to be compared with the current instance.
member.returns: An integer that indicates the relationship between the current instance and the given CoveredCellInfo object.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.CoveredCellInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary:
GetHashCode is intended to serve as a hash function for this object. Based on the contents of the object, the hash function will return a suitable value with a relatively random distribution over the various inputs.
The default implementation returns the [....] block index for this instance. Calling it on the same object multiple times will return the same value, so it will technically meet the needs of a hash function, but it's less than ideal. Objects (especially value classes) should override this method.
member.returns: Return a suitable value with a relatively random distribution over the various inputs based on the contents of the object.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.GridCaptionSummaryCellRenderer
member.summary:
GridCaptionSummaryCellRenderer is a class for cell renderer that displays in a . The class provides strong typed override methods for initializing content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals.
Updates to appearance and content of child elements, creation and unloading of views will not trigger layout or render calls in parent canvas.

member.name: E:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.DataPager.SfDataPager.OnDemandLoading
member.summary: Occurs when loading the page on demand. This event fires only when is enabled.
member.remarks: In normal Paging, data collection is entirely loaded initially to the . However, also allows the user to load the data for the current page dynamically by setting the setting this property to true. To load current page item dynamically you must hook the event. In the event, use the method to load the data for the corresponding page in .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.DataPager.SfDataPager.EnableGridPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create source from or .
member.value: True, if the source is created from , otherwise false. The default value is true.
member.remarks:
The items can be loaded in the Datapager by two ways: normal paging and on demand paging. In normal paging, all the items are loaded initially when the grid is loaded. In on demand paging, the items are loaded to the grid only when navigating to the page i.e. items are loaded dynamically on demand.
When Normal paging is used, the source is created from , since it has to load all the items to the grid. When on demand paging is used, the source is created from , since it has to load the items to the grid for the current page only.
When is set as true, it is necessary to hook the event to load the items dynamically to the grid and set to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.DataPager.SfDataPager.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the items source of the . is bind to the observable collection of data. This property is set only when normal paging is used, since setting this property loads all the items to the grid initially.
member.value: The items source of the .
member.remarks:
The items source of the is set to the collection, based on which is created internally. The is set as .
The items can be loaded in the datapager by two ways: normal paging and on demand paging. In normal paging, all the items are loaded initially when the grid is loaded. In on demand paging, the items are loaded to the grid only when navigating to the page i.e. items are loaded dynamically on demand. property should not be assigned when on demand paging is used.

example.code: sfPager.Source = viewModel.Info; sfGrid.ItemsSource = sfPager.PagedSource;

member.summary: Gets or sets the page display mode for the . The user can customize the buttons to be displayed in the pager, by using this property. By default all the buttons (first, last, next, previous and numeric buttons) will be in view.
member.value: The of .

example.code: sfPager.DisplayMode = PagerDisplayMode.FirstLastNumeric;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.DataPager.SfDataPager.AutoEllipsisMode
member.summary: Gets or sets , which indicates the possible ellipsis mode for the numeric button in the scrollable panel of the . By default, all the numeric buttons in the page will be in view. However, the user can set auto ellipsis mode by using property.
member.value: The for the numeric button in the SfDataPager.

example.code: sfPager.AutoEllipsisMode = AutoEllipsisMode.After;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.DataPager.SfDataPager.UseOnDemandPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable/disable OnDemandPaging. enables the user to generate the items for the current page dynamically by using this property. When on demand paging is enabled, the generation of items is handled by the event, hence it is necessary to hook the . The user cannot assign a value to the when using on demand paging, since the items for the current page is generated only when navigated to that page.
member.value: True if on demand paging is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: In normal Paging, data collection is entirely loaded initially to the . However, also allows the user to load the data for the current page dynamically by setting the setting this property to true. To load current page item dynamically you must hook the event. In the event, use the method to load the data for the corresponding page in .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.DataPager.SfDataPager.AutoEllipsisText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text for the numeric button in auto ellipsis mode. By default, all the numeric buttons in the page will be in view. However, the user can set auto ellipsis mode by using property. allows the user to customize the text to be displayed in the auto ellipsis mode by using this property.
member.value: The text for the numeric button in auto ellipsis button. The default value is "...".

example.code: sfPager.AutoEllipsisMode = AutoEllipsisMode.After; sfPager.AutoEllipsisText = "~~~";

example.code: sfPager.Orientation = ScrollOrientation.Both;
